body:
I know that this is going to do nothing but annoy some people but here we go:

Saying "lag" into the chat, or anything else for that matter, actually increases the amount of lag that you'll experience.  Don't believe me?

When you send a message to the server, what happens is it has to a) receive your message, b) get a list of everyone on the server, and c) send it to each and every one of them.  And then you want it to also process every step that you and every other player makes, while sending a message to everyone else on the server about how much you are annoyed with it?  Why are you wasting your time complaining?  You're making it worse!
body_tagged:

replies.body:
You Do realize it takes only miliseconds for it to process?. And I never seen a chat spammed with "lag"

Take into consideration... "lag" has 3 letters.. (Dont quote me). 1 letter = 1 byte, 'lag'= 3 bytes... Not much at all
replies.body_tagged:
You Do realize it takes only miliseconds for it to process?. And I never seen a chat spammed with "lag"

Take into consideration... "lag" has 3 letters.. (Dont quote me). 1 letter = 1 byte, 'lag'= 3 bytes... Not much at all

replies.body: I know exactly how long it takes to process.  I develop for servers.  But do you know what milliseconds adds up to when you have tons of people saying lag at once?  And it increases based on how many people are online.  It takes milliseconds to send to each person there.  By the time you get a message, it may be seconds after the sender originally sent it on large servers.  I never said it's an earth-shattering amount of time, but it doesn't help anything.  What's the purpose of saying anything anyway?
replies.body_tagged: I know exactly how long it takes to process.  I develop for servers.  But do you know what milliseconds adds up to when you have tons of people saying lag at once?  And it increases based on how many people are online.  It takes milliseconds to send to each person there.  By the time you get a message, it may be seconds after the sender originally sent it on large servers.  I never said it's an earth-shattering amount of time, but it doesn't help anything.  What's the purpose of saying anything anyway?

replies.body:
Solutions for the FPS Lag and Lag Spikes:
- Re-upload / Revamp / Rebuild maps which seem to be corrupted FPS wise (for
example... Mute City 3)

- If your computer / laptop cant handle playing on a FPS intensive map, then i suggest
playing on another map (which means switch to another lobby... that is if a match is
ongoing)

- Get Optifine and play on the lowest quality settings if you are begging for atleast a stable
30 to 60 fps (unless you have a bad enough computer / laptop that even with optifine
you would still get around 5 to 30 fps on average and get a ton of lag spikes which means
get a better / new laptop or computer if you have the time and money for it)

Solutions for Connection Lag (ms / ping):
- Get server hosts in EU, AU, and possibly in Asia for Avicus and Avicus players who come
from those other continental regions who are most likely having problems in game connection
lag wise.

- When your connection isn't stable (like mines) fix your router (if you run on a 3G or 4G
pocket wifi you're either screwed or just find a better place for it or just endure the lag)
or get new internet (most especially if you are from another continental region or
unless you live far from where the server is hosted for example...
Avicus is hosted in the US, and you are from an asian country like the philippines)

- You're last resort and last decision to take... find another server to play on which
most probably you wouldn't enjoy yourself not playing on Avicus if you are really into
it or you enjoy playing on the server...
